intro: Dendrocolla subulata, commonly known as the slender leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming a cluster. Dendrocolla subulata is often found in regions with mild climates and well-drained soils.
